intro: Halenia guatemalensis var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf halenia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
